response_parsed.title: Containerizing Edge Runtimes Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to containerize edge runtimes using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+. We will discuss the setup, key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats for creating Docker containers with FastAPI applications.
key_points: Setting up a FastAPI project in Python 3.12+
Creating a Dockerfile for the FastAPI application
Building, running, and testing the containerized FastAPI application
Deploying the containerized FastAPI application to an edge runtime

code_examples.code:
touch Dockerfile && echo 'FROM python:3.12-slim-buster
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app
RUN pip install fastapi uvicorn requests
CMD ["uvicorn", "main:app", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80"]' > Dockerfile

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use FastAPI.
Uvicorn version 0.17.6 or higher is recommended for running the FastAPI application as a server within the container.
Docker version 20.10.0 or higher is needed for building and running Dockerfiles.
caveats: Make sure to use the correct base image (python:3.12-slim-buster in this case) when creating your Dockerfile to keep the container size minimal.
It's essential to install necessary packages like FastAPI, Uvicorn, and requests within the Dockerfile to avoid missing dependencies during runtime.
Adjust the CMD command in the Dockerfile according to your specific needs (e.g., different host or port numbers).
If you encounter any issues, ensure that your system meets all prerequisites and try troubleshooting common Docker containerization errors.
